basis: User expresses clear intent to maintain a single, simple 3 PM yogurt snack, commits to trying tomorrow, and invites quick nudges; tone is cooperative and proactive.
cognitive_dissonance: Moderate. The user balances a desire for stability with underlying anxiety around eating disorders; they acknowledge potential drift but choose compassionate persistence.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing mindset about sticking to a weekly plan; fear of forgetting meals; sensitivity to new suggestions; self-criticism if slips occur.
emotional_triggers: Meal-related anxiety; fear of loss of control; social influence from others; need for predictability and comfort.
coaching_notes: Maintain gentle, steady support. Reinforce the value of small, repeatable actions and normalize occasional slip-ups. Consider adding a brief post-snack check-in to track hunger and mood, and be ready to adjust timing or snack option if anxiety increases. Offer rotation options only after a stable week or when the user signals readiness.
